channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Giorgio Armani, Italian Fashion Designer, Dies at 91
item.description: He created a male uniform whose feminized form won favor with women. An alliance with movie stars made his name all but synonymous with red-carpet dre...

item.title: Bank of America says the unemployment rate for recent grads is rising faster than all workers
item.description: The report finds that over 13% of unemployed Americans in July were "new entrants" or first-time job-seekers, "which skews towards Gen Z."

item.title: Exclusive: Crypto firm Fireblocks launches a stablecoin payments network
item.description: More than 40 companies have joined the network, including Bridge, a stablecoin startup recently acquired by the fintech giant Stripe.

item.title: The Google antitrust ruling gives its AI rivals one big reason to cheer
item.description: OpenAI, Perplexity, Meta. and others could benefit from judge's order that Google share its 'search index'

item.title: Whistle-Blower Complaints Detail Tension Over Vaccines at N.I.H.
item.description: Two former agency leaders said the administration’s “hostility” toward vaccines had spread to the agency’s top ranks.

item.title: Google stock hits all-time high after government backs down and it has AI rivals to thank
item.description: Alphabet’s stock closed up 8% Thursday at $231.10, its highest level ever.

item.title: Giorgio Armani’s Life in Photos
item.description: One of the most prolific fashion designers in history, he turned a certain kind of Italian chic into an international phenomenon.

item.title: Lisbon Funicular Crash: What to Know About Cause and Victims
item.description: At least 16 people were killed after the Glória funicular, one of the city’s most popular tourist attractions, crashed.

item.title: Portugal Searches for Cause of Lisbon Funicular Crash as Death Toll Rises
item.description: The authorities were also working to identify the victims, which a local official said included some foreigners. The funicular is popular with tourist...

item.title: Powerball jackpot hits $1.7 billion, its third-highest prize ever
item.description: The odds of winning the Powerball jackpot are one in 292.2 million, according to official lottery data.

item.title: Portugal Mourns Dead in Lisbon Funicular Crash
item.description: Emergency crews worked on Thursday at the site of a funicular crash in Lisbon that killed at least 16 people the evening before. The cause was still b...

item.title: Inside Trump’s Unorthodox Climate Attacks in Courts Nationwide
item.description: The administration is cranking up efforts to kill state laws and legal cases that would force fossil-fuel companies to pay for climate damage.

item.title: Portugal Searches for Cause of Lisbon Funicular Crash as Death Toll Rises
item.description: The authorities were also working to identify the victims, which a local official said included some foreigners. The funicular is popular with tourist...

item.title: Lisbon Funicular Crash: What to Know About Cause and Victims
item.description: At least 16 people were killed after the Glória funicular, one of the city’s most popular tourist attractions, derailed and crashed.

item.title: Europe Aims to Show It Is Ready to Secure Postwar Ukraine
item.description: President Emmanuel Macron of France is hosting a meeting of leaders who will review options for protecting any peace with Russia.
